What is meant, Buddha's disciple! by the bodhisattvas' beholding the TathÄgata to an unlimited extent?
If the bodhisattvas approach the TathÄgata, then they return to the Way.
Why is it so?
Those who see nothing, they see the TathÄgata;
Those who see the TathÄgata, they are the one Dharma body;
With the one Dharma body, if with a mind of one kindness they turn to one person, then it pervades all beings, nurturing many.

Just as the realm of space does not exclude anything, does not fail to enter anywhere, whether reaching all that has form or is formless, has shape or is shapeless, has a place or has no place, it also does not arrive anywhere, and it also does not come, it has no body;
Because it has no body, there is nothing it does not pervade.
The Buddha's body is like this, universally entering all kinds of beings, pervading all dharmas and all buddha-lands without exception, yet it does not go anywhere and does not come from anywhere.
Why is this?
Because it has no body.
The TathÄgata's body is only manifested in order to teach and transform beings.
This is it, Buddha's disciple!
The bodhisattva enters the first gate, and when he returns and manifests, he is called the TathÄgata.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!

It is like empty space, which has no color, is invisible, has no form, and cannot be seen. Yet it is known through discrimination that it contains and covers all kinds of beings, and it is vast and far-reaching without oppressing them, and empty space also has no thoughts.

In the same way, if one sees the TathÄgata's body universally illuminating the world and transcending worldly matters, and through distinguishing merit and demerit, the TathÄgata does not come and also does not go, unobstructed and unobtainable.
Why is it so?
The great sage's light eliminates all eighty kinds of inversions. This is the second gate of entry.
Then, he spoke in verse:
Because of giving rise to and pursuing, the majestic light and radiance are exhausted,
Fully seeing all sentient beings, increasing and decreasing various causes and conditions.
Like space without form or color, the TathÄgata is also like this,
With a single equal Dharma body, saving and liberating the various kinds of sentient beings.
The supreme one appears and transforms all those in darkness,
Gradually observing the principles, flourishing and encountering the Buddha's path.
The Way and virtue are extremely vast, illuminating the trichiliocosm,
Liberating from the difficulties of birth and death, the mind is completely without thought.
The Honored One among humans is unequaled, manifesting increase and decrease,
If there are those who instruct themselves, they will attain the state of a pratyekabuddha.
All sentient beings know to draw near to the Sage among humans,
Just like the great brahmin, dwelling in the clear and bright palace.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
The light of the sun illuminates JambudvÄ«pa, and the immeasurable grace of sentient beings relies on it to survive, shining limitlessly.
Just like flowing water coming from mountains and streams, it nourishes the growth of a hundred grains and clothing, and even dark and unclear places rely on it;
Flying insects, worms, cattle, horses, and donkeys also depend on it;
What is to be read and spoken, valleys, trees, and various herbs also rely on it;
Disputes and emptiness are all resolved;
Sentient beings traveling in the sky also rely on it;
Rivers, bathing pools, springs, and flowing water also depend on it;
The lotus flowers open, illuminating the prefectures, counties, states, and great cities, and one can see various forms and colors.
Wandering in the fields and among the grasses, the people on land and the various kinds in the water all look up to it.
Each cultivates their livelihood and what they undertake can be completed.
Why is this?
The palace of the sun's light illuminates immeasurably, benefiting beings with its virtue like the sun.

If the multitude sees the TathÄgata's body and hears his voice, they will attain innumerable and limitless expedient causes and conditions, and in reliance, they will find peace and turn away from evil to cultivate virtuous dharmas. They will eliminate foolishness, extinguish all dark matters, and promote the wisdom of the Way, shining brightly.ğŸ”½Great compassion universally protects all beings;
great pity rescues and delivers the masses.

Returning to and relying on all dharmas, nurturing and accomplishing the power of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, planting the seeds of pure faith, like turbid water becoming clear and pure.

What is seen is not empty, and retribution is not lost. Whether there is form or not, the matter of birth and death is all seen, without any harm. The light of the wisdom of the Way causes sentient beings not to lose their virtuous roots.
The great beings who are the leaders of the assembly, like lotus flowers, encourage and transform giving and all practices, and the expedient means are the most supreme.
Why is it so?
The holy Way is boundless.
The TathÄgata's shaking of immeasurable wisdom light, and the boundless holy Way are also like this. This is the third gate of entry.
Then he spoke in verse:
It is like the sun palace, illuminating the entire JambudvÄ«pa,
Hanging its light in the sky, removing darkness without obstruction.
Originally non-existent, with no location, born from the lotus in the causal ground,
Relying on and relying on the various lands;
The supreme sun is also like this, with sentient beings all looking up to it.
The gods and people of the world, who cultivate the basis of virtue well,
Subduing the limitless, attaining the light of the Dharma,
Seeing the sage among humans, thus accomplishing the three vehicles.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

It is like the sun palace illuminating the great stone emperor Sumeru Mountain King, next illuminating the other great mountains, next illuminating the black mountains, and finally illuminating the hills, mounds, and places on the ground - the places where the people of this JambudvÄ«pa live.
The light follows the ground, and the light of the sun palace has no thought or words, saying:
'It should first illuminate the king of treasure mountains.'
Also, the sun shines without distinction - the high and low places in that land are not specially affected by the sun's light, and it does not think of first and last.

The TathÄgata is like this, equally wandering in the immeasurable Dharma realm of loyalty and correctness, in the lofty Way-place, then emitting the light of non-deception, with this wisdom-illumination universally illuminating all.

It is said that the great emperor Shi Shan Sumeru first encountered the light, then it is said to lead the great righteous ones to manifest the Dharma-light for them, to enlighten and liberate them, and then to show the wisdom that is admired by the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas. Sentient beings give rise to aspirations and establish roots of virtue, and then transform those in the unwholesome party, gradually teaching all the people who dwell in wrong views, all of whom are universally illuminated by the TathÄgata's light.

Having received the light, they will attain the prediction, and in the future they will encounter the TathÄgata's sun-like wisdom, causing them to be free from thoughts and accomplish all virtuous roots, in accordance with their aspirations they will attain the illumination of wisdom. This is the fourth entrance.

Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
It is like the sun palace, which the congenitally blind cannot see the majestic light.
Although they have no eyes and do not know day from night, they continue to rely on the light to make a living and obtain food and drink.
In the same way, sentient beings lose their original purity, and seeing the Buddha without believing in the boundless light of the ultimate Way is called congenital blindness.
Although they do not see the light of wisdom of the TathÄgata, even so, they will continue to be illuminated by the sun of the Great Sage.
In this way, the subtle, vast, and bright spiritual powers shine on their bodies.
Establishing auspicious responses, in the future they will eliminate the practices of desire and dust, this is the fifth entrance.
Then, he spoke in verse:
Just as the sun shines on the world, the congenitally blind cannot see,
Although they do not distinguish day from night, they continue to be illuminated by its radiance.
Sentient beings lose their original purity, and do not believe in the wisdom of the TathÄgata,
The Buddha's kindness and compassion are vast, and we will continue to receive liberation.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!
It is like the moon palace, which manifests four unprecedented phenomena.
What are the four?
Illuminating all darkness, being among the stars while always being vast and bright;
For those who have lost their way, pointing out the location, universally traveling the world while accommodating all;
Having seen the moonlight, sentient beings look up in admiration;
Standing in accordance with the directions, wherever it travels and emerges, without harboring doubt, these are the four.
In this way, the TathÄgata's body has four difficulties and unprecedented manifestations that are difficult to attain and unseen by others.
What are the four?
Universally manifesting all learners and non-learners;
The vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas' vows, according to their faith and joy, manifests accordingly;
Limited matters and the bounds of lifespan, for those who are depleted, it shows increase and benefit;
The TathÄgata's enlightenment site neither increases nor decreases, and all see the various types of sentient beings in all buddha-realms and their thoughts.
In accordance with their power and faith, for those who are suitable vessels for the Way, by what kind of light, they all see and revere the Buddha's body, which illuminates them all.
Moreover, the TathÄgata's body is without thought or recollection, and is able to attain the unattached mind. This is the sixth entrance.
Then he spoke in verse:
The moon's light shines, encircling Mount Sumeru,
The light reaches all the mountains, and then to the mountain slopes,
Next it illuminates the high lands, and then to the flat ground,
Gradually illuminating the low-lying areas, all the lands.
The light first shines on the bodhisattvas who abide in peace,
Then it radiates light on the practices of the pratyekabuddhas,
Then it illuminates the self-mastery, next illuminating the learners and adepts,
Then it illuminates the multitude without remainder, the Buddha's path without thought.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciples!
Like the great Brahma Heaven named the Three Thousand, it manifests the body everywhere in the Three Thousand Worlds without exception, and does not divide the body.
Any beings of various kinds that have form, according to their appearance, all manifest before them, without fail.

The Tathagata, the Arhat is also like this, never dividing the body, having no multiple essence, universally in all worlds, according to the inclinations, natures, forms, and what the people can believe and enjoy, he manifests it. The great sage's body and mind are also without thought. This is the seventh entrance.
Then he spoke in verse:
The Brahma Heaven named the Three Thousand, universally manifests its form everywhere,
In the multitude of powers, each is honored, freely seen without exception.
Does not divide its essence;ğŸ”½The guide of all dharmas,
The sovereign is also like this.ğŸ”½The Buddha's body universally manifests,
In the worlds of the ten directions,ğŸ”½Its image is immeasurable,
And does not divide its essence.
All people each think:
Now present before me.ğŸ”½All see the Buddha's image,
And hear the Dharma he expounds.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!

Like a great doctor who knows all medicines, distinguishing good and bad, and their classifications, understanding various scriptures, classics, and spells, in the world, all medicines are unknown to people, who consider them useless.
The original virtues of medicine and the power of medical spells manifest to the masses. As soon as they see this doctor, their illnesses are all cured, and they all attain peace and security.
Moreover, this doctor does not rely on his own power to establish himself in the present. He thinks to himself:
'These people are about to lose their protector. If I pass away, they will be orphaned and alone. How can I devise a skillful means to demonstrate it?'

He collected various medicines and applied them to his body. Relying on the power of his medical skills and the combined effects of the medicines, he showed as if he had passed away - his body did not decay, wither, or break apart. He moved around, sat, and walked as if transformed, using medicine to cure the illnesses of sentient beings. Hearing and seeing his voice, they also attained peace, without any difference before and after.

The TathÄgata is also like this. He is the unsurpassed king of physicians, who understands how to treat the afflictions of all sentient beings. For hundreds of thousands of koá¹­Ä«s of kalpas, he has created medicines, universally returning to the perfection of omniscience, skillfully learning the methods and medicines of the path. All of these were established when he was a bodhisattva in the past. He practiced wisdom, skillful means, spells, and taking medicine. With the power of his majestic virtue, he abides until the end of the future.
In this way, he has no limit in the midst of sentient beings, and he arises to protect and treat the various illnesses of the masses.
This is having no body and no activities.

His body is pure. All sentient beings who see him have their afflictions of desire and toil cured. Even those who do not believe will continue to attain peace. All buddha-works are never interrupted. This is the eighth gate of entry.
Then he spoke in verse:
It is like a skillful doctor who has learned all medical techniques,
Those who see this teacher will have all their illnesses eliminated.
If a person is gravely ill, carrying medicine to treat them,
Then they will apply it to their own body, displaying all dignified deportment.
The Honored One among Humans is like this, the king of doctors is immeasurable,
He manifests the holy wisdom, skillfully learning the medical techniques of wisdom.
Going to the practices of the past, he therefore manifests the honored holy body,
When the multitude sees it, the illness of desire is eliminated without remainder.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

In the great ocean there is a great treasure jewel, a lapis lazuli treasury, called 'Manifesting All Lights,' those who see the radiance of this great treasure jewel or encounter this jewel will all transform into the appearance of a lapis lazuli treasury.
If a person sees the color of the great treasure jewel, their eyes will immediately become pure and they will universally attain peace and security;
The great pearl's light illuminates the majestic palace, and all beings are shrouded in its light, forever free from suffering.
Like the great jewel called Pacifying All, wherever it is, if it rains, all beings immediately attain peace and rest from all toil.
The TathÄgata's radiance is also like this, a great treasure, the inexhaustible wisdom treasury of all merit and virtue.
If beings encounter the TathÄgata's holy wisdom-illumination, they will all attain the same kind and ascend to the treasure of the path of true enlightenment;
If they see the TathÄgata, they will attain the five eyes;
Encountering the great sage's light, all the poor and destitute will obtain the Dharma treasure and then attain inexhaustible wealth and even the peace of the TathÄgata's peace.
Buddha's disciples!
Just observe the majestic appearance of the Perfectly Enlightened One, who without speaking universally benefits and guides the masses. This is the ninth entrance.
Then he spoke in verse:
It is like someone without precious treasures, who goes to the deep sea to seek jewels,
Obtaining all kinds of luminous pearls, their light illuminating everywhere.
If a person encounters this pearl, they will then attain naturalness;
Those who see it with their eyes will soon obtain pure vision.
The supreme treasure is also like this, emitting the light of wisdom.
If a person encounters this radiance, they will then attain the Buddha's appearance;
If one contemplates the supreme, one will then attain the five eyes,
Eliminating all darkness and obscurity, and then abide in the Buddha's stage.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

There is a great precious pearl called the King of the Treasury of All Pure Thoughts. The merit and spiritual power of this great precious pearl is not ten, not a thousand, but accumulated and attained.
Moreover, wherever this great pearl is placed, in that place all beings will be completely free from illness and various afflictions;
If the multitude of people follow the vows and aspirations of the mani jewel, they will all be fulfilled and obtain what they wish for.
Moreover, that jewel does not illuminate those who lack merit.
The king's jewel of the treasury of all pure thoughts refers to the TathÄgata, who delights in the various kinds of sentient beings.

The body of the TathÄgata, which is manifested through the samÄdhi of the Perfectly Enlightened One, praises and extols the assembly of Å›rÄvakas. All sentient beings in saá¹ƒsÄra, within the five sufferings, attain the extraordinary and transcend beginning and end.
Moreover, O Buddha's disciple!
The TathÄgata's body is without front or back.

All sentient beings in the world who have previously had blessings will all be single-minded and without disordered thoughts. Upholding correct mindfulness, purifying all practices, diligently progressing towards the TathÄgata, they will all attain the Dharma and fulfill their aspirations.
Those with heavy offenses have no roots of virtue and cannot see the TathÄgata's light. They should be established and encouraged, and their roots of virtue shown to them. This is the tenth entrance.

For bodhisattva practice to reach true enlightenment, to enter close to the TathÄgata and reach the immeasurable mind's thoughts, that which is vast and all-pervades the ten directions, and to practice without obstruction.
Moreover, the Dharma realm is observing the various realms, not dwelling in the fundamental state.
Moreover, the TathÄgata is without arising and without cessation, equally in the three times, and has no thoughts regarding any thoughts.

Guiding and benefiting the multitude, entering this path without remainder until the end of future minds, and filling all buddha-realms, fully endowed with the Dharma body, all tathÄgatas are one pure thing.
Then he spoke in verse:
It is like a wish-fulfilling jewel that can fulfill all wishes,
If there are those who seek, they will obtain as they wish.
Those who lack merit will not see the treasure,
And the supreme and wondrous jewel will forever be free from thoughts of stinginess.
Dwelling in the body like this, granting all wishes,
If one sees where it goes, it will be accomplished as one wishes.
Those who harbor thoughts of danger and peril will not see the Buddha,
The TathÄgata is free from thoughts of stinginess and also has no greed or jealousy.
The Buddha said to Samantabhadra Bodhisattva:
What is meant, son of the Buddha!
How does a bodhisattva follow the TathÄgata's voice and equally understand and proclaim the sound of right enlightenment?
Innumerable sounds and words then expound the Dharma according to the inclinations of sentient beings' minds, causing the assembly to each obtain what they enjoy.

In accordance with their aspirations, they manifest transformations, following their thoughts, entering in a timely manner, without losing samÄdhi, without ending, without sinking, without arising, and without extinguishing.
Moreover, observing them is like an echo, all without a master, and also without a self, because of the accumulation of the practices of the offenses and merits of sentient beings.

Deviating from the profound and wonderful, there is then a return, far-reaching and difficult to save, giving rise to impurity, discriminating the dharma realm, and therefore following without interruption.
Because of not abandoning the Dharma of destruction, there is no anger, no hatred, no sinking, and no ultimate end;
Because of abiding in the object, there is also no master, no non-master, no teaching, and no non-teaching.
This is then following the sound of the TathÄgata.
Why is it so?
For example, when the world encounters a great calamity, there are then naturally four great sounds, and only then can one know the Dharma without a master, and without greedy actions.
What are the four?
When calamities and disasters occur in the world, a great sound will naturally emerge, saying:
Virtuous ones, listen!
The first meditation is peaceful.
The first meditation is free from the afflictions of love and hatred, transcends the desire realm, and naturally leads to transcendence.
Then, sentient beings who hear this sound attain the first meditation, transcend the desire realm, and are born in the Brahma Heaven.
Having attained the Dharma, they hear a second sound, saying:
Virtuous ones, listen!
The second meditation is peaceful, free from conceptual activities, transcends the Brahma Heaven, and leads to mastery.

Then, sentient beings who hear this second sound practice the second meditation, free from conceptualization and activities, with inner tranquility and no attachment in the mind, attain the second meditation, and are born in the Ä€bhÄsvara Heaven.

Virtuous ones, listen!
The third meditation is most peaceful, free from the desire for joy, with the mind in tranquil concentration, and no thoughts within.
The third meditation is to transcend the Ä€bhÄsvara Heaven according to the teachings of the sages.

In this way, there is no master, no creation, no correspondence, no non-correspondence, no lifting, no lowering.
If there are those who wish to attain the TathÄgata's Dharma, then there will be four natural sounds and four teachings.
What are the four?
The first sound says:

The three destinies of hell, hungry ghosts, and animals, calculating the self and others, saying 'this is mine,' and being attached to all things are also suffering.

If one plants roots of virtue, one will be born in the heavens or among humans, receive the teachings of the sages, abandon the eight difficult and dangerous destinies, and practice the ten wholesome deeds, then all calamities will be removed and one will always encounter the Buddha's teachings.
The second sound says:
All of you listen!
All things are suffering, burning, blazing, and oppressing each other.
Thoughts are full of troubles, and the body is impermanent.
The Dharma of separation is formless and tranquil, not aspiring for offerings, it is then unflaming, and one will eventually leave all difficulties.
' At that time, upon hearing this sound, the people upheld and practiced it, gradually becoming diligent and attaining the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle, reaching the other shore through patience.
The third sound said:
'Beyond the Arhat stage is the subtle and delightful vehicle called the Pratyekabuddha, which has no teacher but self-realization.'
Then, upon hearing this sound, the people joyfully and slightly progressed, attaining the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.
The fourth sound said:

The Mahayana is the most venerable vehicle, the most extraordinary vehicle, the vehicle borne by all beings, the vehicle of surpassing faith and joy, the true vehicle.

Having heard this sound, those with clear faculties and ancient roots of virtue, established by the majestic spiritual power of the Tathagata, will have their aspirations expanded and greatly illuminated, and will spontaneously give rise to the intention for enlightenment.
The sound declares:
'The Tathagatas have no body, no mind, and also nothing to expound or to transform, yet they enable beings to receive peace and comfort.
This, O Buddha's disciple!
Is the first causal event for bodhisattvas to be able to accord with the Tathagata's sound.
Then, he spoke in verse:ğŸ”½Just as the sound of the four immeasurables
Pervades the world,ğŸ”½The realm of beings is pure,
Originally arising from the boundless.
Then there are four kinds of wisdom, tranquil and peaceful meditation,
When the multitude hears this sound, they will then abandon the desire realm.
The Ten Powers are also like this, pervading the Dharma realm,
For the sake of sentient beings, they expound immeasurable sounds.
Those who attain this seal will transcend the characteristics of conditioned existence,
Dwelling in the sound, they never have any doubts.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
It is like the sound between the cliffs of a deep mountain, which arises due to conditions;
The world is like this, recording this worldly language, which has no existence, and the body also has no existence. When seen, it is due to calling out and then there is sound.
All sounds and languages arise from the ears, if one truly contemplates them, they are forever without thought.
In this way, good sir!
The Tathagata's sound has no teachings and no location.

Sentient beings harbor thoughts of the Way, and their intentions arise from causes and conditions. Even if one investigates the principles of sound, there is no echo and nothing to be attained. This is it, Buddha's disciple!
The second condition is to be able to follow the TathÄgata's sound for the sake of all bodhisattvas.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as in a deep mountain, there is an echo due to conditions,
Responding to all sounds according to the many people's calls.
The Buddha encourages and transforms the multitude, using sound to enlighten them,
Although there is speech and explanation, there has never been any doubt or thought.
The sound of the Ten Powers, with no attachment to the Dharma realm,
Distinguishing and guiding people, controlling and transforming the roots of the faculties.
For all the subtle sentient beings, causing them to be delighted,
For those with the Ten Powers, not harboring deluded thoughts or seeking.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!
When the sound of a great thunder resounds, it is called the true Dharma of the devas. If the devas are wandering and being indulgent, then the Dharma thunder will immediately resound in the sky:
'All desires and passions are impermanent, suffering, and deceptive for a moment. They are practiced by the foolish, not by the vigilant. Do not pursue them.
If you indulge yourselves, you will fall into evil destinies, do not be deluded.'

The indulgent devas, hearing this teaching, will then become sorrowful. Each of them will abandon the pleasures of desire and go to the palace of the Heavenly King, delighting in the inexhaustible scriptures of the Heavenly King, and revering the practice of the Dharma.

Just observe that the sound of the Dharma thunder is naturally so, without any difference. It arises for the sake of the multitude of devas and humans, in order to establish beings, that this sound exists.

The TathÄgata's voice is also like this. It cannot be attained, but it spreads the great Dharma sound according to people's practices, the sound of no greed, no karma, no heedlessness, impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and non-self. It announces the Dharma realm, reaches everywhere without exception, and universally pervades sentient beings. It encourages and transforms them according to their desires, bringing them joy and delight. It guides them with the Three Vehicles, causing each to attain their place. It is the practice of bodhisattvas with immeasurable and sovereign wisdom, causing them all to enter the inconceivable.
Moreover, the TathÄgata's wisdom has no possessions and no abode, yet he uses it to guide and proclaim to all.

Having heard this sound, countless types of sentient beings diligently practice according to these roots of virtue, either seeking the vehicle of Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or aspiring for the unsurpassed great vehicle.
Moreover, the Buddha's voice universally reaches everywhere, without attachment or verbal expression. This is the third way for bodhisattvas to follow the TathÄgata's voice.
Then, he spoke in verse:
If the heavens let loose in heedlessness, there will naturally be thunder and lightning,
Illuminating the various dharmas, causing delight in the meaning of the Way,
Then in the empty sky, the sound of the Dharma will be proclaimed and explained.
When the devas hear this sound, they will immediately change and not run wild.
The Ten Powers are also like this, thundering and expounding the Dharma rain,
Flowing and overflowing in the ten directions, guiding and benefiting all beings.
Fully endowed with supreme speech, using it to enlighten and transform others,
Having heard this sound, the people will accomplish the Buddha's Way.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

It is like a celestial son named Self-Mastery, also named Good Gate, who looks in the direction he wishes to go, and then hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens gather around him, playing drums, lutes, and singing in harmony with the strings, with various rhythms, and he watches the wonderful music being performed.

The TathÄgata is like this, using a single voice to accord with the minds of the various beings, according to their fundamental dispositions and inclinations, and with immeasurable practices, manifesting teachings for each according to their faith, causing them to attain understanding. This is the fourth for the bodhisattvas to be able to follow the TathÄgata's voice.
Then he spoke in verse:
It is like MÄra indulging himself, creating celestial music,
With the appearance and faces of celestial maidens, harmonizing with the rhythms,
Singing in unison, producing wonderful melodies with the same pitch,
With hundreds of thousands of various new sounds in full possession.
The TathÄgatas are like this, always expounding a single sound proclamation,
Then, using skillful means, the voice resounds to the masses.
The people follow their faith and joy, and if they get to hear the teachings,
As soon as they listen, their afflictions are severed, and the sound has no thought.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

Just as the Great Brahma, dwelling in the heavenly palace, in the time it takes to form an intention, the sound of his admonition overflows to the outside and the assembly, causing all the Brahma gods and Brahma-body gods to respectfully receive his sound command.
In this way, good sir!

The Tathagata, the Right and Universal Awakened One, emits the unsurpassed subtle Buddha voice, universally announcing to the entire assembly, silent within, the sound reaching the ten directions, opening and liberating the masses, causing them to reach the Way-place.
The TathÄgata's equal compassion is not stingy with sentient beings.

Sentient beings' faculties are impure, not tranquil, seeing and hearing the Dharma teachings but not loving them, all of them are able to universally gather at the Way-place, each thinking in their mind:
'Now, the TathÄgata alone expounds the sound of the Dharma for me.'
Moreover, the TathÄgata's sound is also without control, yet it establishes and accomplishes the teachings to be given, this is the fifth for the bodhisattvas to attain the TathÄgata's sound.
Then he spoke in verse:
If one attains the honored position, the seat of the Brahma Heaven,
Then with a single word one can instruct, pleasing the mind of the Brahma Heaven.
The echo of the Brahma Heaven does not transcend to the outside,
One fully knows all minds, as well as the intentions of the assembly that has come.
It is said that the virtues of the ten powers, purified in the Buddha's seat,
Then one expounds a single sound, pervading the Dharma realm.
Not displeasing the assembly, also not harboring greed,
Those who do not have firm faith do not hear the Buddha's sound.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

Just as they calculate water, all the same, considering it to be of one flavor, if it follows the various changes in the vessels, and further distinguishes the knowledge that the flavors are each different.

The Dharma teachings are like this. If the TathÄgata's teachings are of one flavor, it is called the flavor of liberation. The minds and dispositions of sentient beings are each different. What the Perfectly Enlightened One says is not the same. The TathÄgata's voice is without thought or recollection. This is the sixth way by which the bodhisattvas can accord with the TathÄgata's voice.
Then he spoke in verse, saying:
Just as they calculate all the waters, naturally raining down,
The flavors are equal, pure and clean, without defilement, with eight kinds of sweetness;
The Buddha's disciples are like this, understanding the sounds of sentient beings,
If they aspire to one flavor, they will attain the naturally enlightened path of the Buddha.
Because they encounter causes and conditions, they follow the different grounds,
The vessels are each different, causing the water to never be the same;
All kinds of beings, with their various practices,
Hear the Buddha's voice according to their minds, and what they listen to is not the same.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciples!

Just as the great dragon king Anavatapta, when it wants to rain, covers the entire JambudvÄ«pa with dark clouds, and then sends down rain, nurturing the hundred grains, various medicines, trees, bamboos, groves... all of which flourish, with abundant flowers and fruits.
The source of all rivers comes from the body of the dragon king Anavatapta, causing countless things and various kinds of beings to be nourished.
In this way, good people!

The TathÄgata universally covers all worlds without exception, and with great compassion and kindness, he rains down the sweet dew of the great Dharma, delighting sentient beings, nurturing their merits and virtues, and fully equipping them with the vehicles of the ten directions.

The TathÄgata's voice does not come from within nor without. In this way, countless immeasurable people and various kinds of beings receive and uphold it. This is the seventh for the bodhisattvas to attain accord with the TathÄgata's voice.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as the flowing waters pervade the JambudvÄ«pa,
Without not penetrating through, universally moistening the great earth.
Mountains, hills, grasses, various trees, and the five grains depend on it to grow,
There are those who observe the water, where it goes without thought.
The World-Honored One is also like this, proclaiming the various Dharma realms,
Scattering the rain of the true Dharma, filling the multitudes with beings.
Nurturing the hundreds of thousands of wholesome [minds], eliminating the various afflictions,
Having already understood the Buddha's words, not running wild outside.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

It is like the great nÄga king Manasa. When he brings forth great dark clouds and rain, he first gathers the clouds, covering the heavenly palaces without exception, and does not let fall a single drop of rain. He observes whether the people's agricultural work is universally prepared, and then rains.
Why is it so?
It is because he does not want to trouble sentient beings.
The great nÄga king thinks and slowly releases fine drops for seven days, universally covering the fields and benefiting many.
Thus, good man!
The TathÄgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is the great Dharma King, bringing forth the heavy Dharma clouds and transforming sentient beings.

If there is a path, he rains down the taste of sweet dew for the pure ones, and then expounds the ultimate Dharma transformation, raining down the Dharma's moisture and expounding the profound scriptures, not causing sentient beings to have fearful thoughts.

Proclaiming the taste of unsurpassed spiritual powers, filling many with contentment and enabling them to achieve accomplishment, this is the eighth for the bodhisattvas to attain the TathÄgata's voice in accordance with.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as there is a virtuous dragon, named ManÄsa,
It rains for seven days, with gentle rain causing no harm.ğŸ”½The reason this dragon comes is
To accomplish the karmic activities of sentient beings,
Then it displays compassion and peacefully showers rain.
The Ten Powers, for the sake of the people, gather like clouds and spread the Dharma-covering,
Desiring to transform sentient beings, it reveals the ultimate truth.
In accordance with the vessels of those people, it proclaims the profound Dharma-sounds,
Hearing the teachings without fear, it enters the Buddha's wisdom.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

It is like a great dragon king in the great ocean named Great Purity, who in a single thought can produce ten kinds of rain, which countless hundreds of thousands of kinds do not fail to be moistened;
The rain has no thought, and the dragon king also has no different thoughts. The rain is natural, causing the hundreds of thousands of kinds to be differentiated.
It is like this, good man!

If the TathÄgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One wishes to expound the rain of the Dharma sound, in the time of giving rise to thought, he distinguishes ten dharmas and understands their return, proclaiming the shining Dharma and emitting a hundred kinds of sounds, or else he clearly expounds the practices of eighty-four thousand sentient beings, manifests the sounds that enter eighty-four thousand, and reaches the sounds of countless hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of words, delighting the minds of limitless sentient beings.
The teachings of the Way and the sounds of the Dharma also have no thoughts, and then they break through all the fundamental causes.

The Dharma of the TathÄgata, if the utmost of kindness is of various kinds of transformations, it is well-wrought, pure, and lofty like this. This is the ninth to attain compliance with the TathÄgata's voice for the bodhisattvas.
Then he spoke a verse, saying:
Just like the eldest son of the great majestic and pure nÄga king,
First he gathers clouds and then it rains.
The Buddha's way is then natural, and the master has what he delivers.
The mouth emits ten kinds of sounds, twenty, or up to a hundred,
Or up to a hundred thousand, the Dharma's moisture is of unlimited measure,
What is revered is without expression, and the Dharma realm is not destroyed.
The self-indulgent nÄga king is the most revered among all nÄgas,ğŸ”½The shade and rain are moreover universally reaching, pervading the four directions,
Moistening all forms, the rain falls in various kinds,
But the water in the ocean has no various kinds.
The World-Honored One is also like this, with the teachings of the Way being of one kind,
But the minds of practitioners are each different, so what they attain is not the same.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciples!
When the great dragon king of the ocean wishes to give rise to immeasurable movements and transformations, he must comfort sentient beings, causing them to be filled with joy.
Raining down on the four continents, covering the entire great earth, reaching up to the palace of the god of freedom in the clear heavens, the clouds spread out and shade various kinds.

Moreover, the clouds manifest such forms, with various differences, either purple-gold color, or yellow color, or lapis lazuli color, or white silver color, or crystal color, or red pearl color, or agate light, or cat's eye light, or emerald light.
Thus, covered by such a great cloud, it pervades the four continents and the four heavens.
Moreover, the water is without distinction, yet the clouds and mist spread out in various forms.

After the lightning appears, a great thunder resounds, and rain falls according to the desires of the masses. Sometimes the sound of jade maidens singing and dancing emerges, or the sound of heavenly qin, zither, and various musical instruments, flutes and harmonies, or the sound of the music of the dragon queens, or the sound of the music of the gandharva queens, or the sound of the music of the asura couples, or the sound of the land's offerings, or the sound of the music of the thunder and waves in the ocean, or the sound of the cry of the king of deer, or the sound of the music of the indestructible bird, or the sound of the dance of myriad kinds.
The appearance of the cover of the great cloud's darkness is like this. At that time, a great joy naturally arises, and the dragon wind blows everywhere.

If the wind emerges, the clouds and mist are peaceful. First, a fine drizzle is released, and later a great rain is scattered - reaching up to the clear heavens of mastery, and pervading the earth below, the heavenly palaces in the sky, and all that is connected - the rain in the great ocean is indestructible.

It rained various kinds of music and dance for the heavenly maidens of the Heaven of Free Enjoyment of Manifestations by Others, various wish-fulfilling jewels for the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, pearl necklaces for the Heaven of the Thirty-three, various kinds of flowers for the Heaven of the Four Kings, soft and famous incense for the Heaven of the Thirty-three, fine clothing for the Four Heavenly Kings, subtle flowers for Uttarakuru, surpassing light red pearls for the palace of the great dragon kings, and weapons for the asuras called destroying the enemy.
In this way, the rain spread throughout the four directions and the realms of the four continents and the heavenly palaces, beyond measure.
The great dragon king of the ocean was not stingy or jealous.
Moreover, the roots of virtue planted by sentient beings were each different and not the same, naturally transforming into a rain of distinctions.
In this way, O Buddha's disciple!

The TathÄgata, the Arhat, by means of unsurpassed wisdom as the great Dharma King, always manifests the joy of the Dharma and delights in it himself. In silence, he spreads the Dharma realm everywhere, and the Dharma body's shadowy clouds are all-pervading.

In accordance with the faith and joy of sentient beings, he manifests it. For some sentient beings, he proclaims and manifests the body of the Most Perfectly Enlightened One and causes the Dharma rain to arise; he manifests the transformation body and releases the Dharma cloud rain; he manifests the established body and causes the Dharma rain to descend; he manifests the body of various forms and the rain of various kinds; he manifests the meritorious body and expounds the cloud rain; he may also manifest the cloud rain of the wisdom body; he may also follow worldly customs and manifest his body with the ten powers; he may also manifest the body of the four kinds of fearlessnessâ€”naturally manifesting without any deficiency; he may also manifest the Dharma realm without a physical form. This is how the great sage's Dharma body's shadowy rain universally pervades the world.
In accordance with the faith and joy in sounds, he expounds his radiant light for sentient beings and removes all impurities.

This light is called the light of equality, or the light of immeasurability, or the light of universal world, or the secret treasury established by the Buddha, or the light illuminating the world, or the practice of inexhaustibility entering the gate of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, or the mind that is not confused, or the mind that is without a companion, or the entry by means of walking, or the light that delights the multitude's wishes.
In this way, the sound of thunder heard in the rain of the Dharma reaches perfect enlightenment and clearly understands the Buddha's path.

If they attain the equality of the thunder, they will then understand the seal of non-defilement, the thunder of samÄdhi, the natural sound - the samÄdhi of mastery over all dharmas, the vajra-field samÄdhi, the Sumeru banner samÄdhi, the samÄdhi of the light of the sun, the samÄdhi of the seal of the great ocean, the samÄdhi of pleasing the minds of the people, the samÄdhi of inexhaustible echo liberation and non-anger, the samÄdhi of having no desires, the samÄdhi of always compassionately not losing - if they proclaim their voices, each will hear this sound of the Buddha's teachings.

The TathÄgata's body expounds the nectar, producing countless clouds and rain of Dharma sounds. The heard Dharma expounds the unequaled enjoyment of beings. This is the inconceivable door of omniscience of the Perfectly Enlightened One.

Satisfying the minds of all beings, each according to their time, it is called the stage of vast wisdom, accomplishing the ancient immaculate skillful means, great compassion, ultimately without negligence, flourishing the transformative teaching of the Way, this is what is to be followed.
All bodhisattvas determine their body and mind, and then they expound the great Dharma rain. This is it, Buddha's disciple!

If this form manifests the great Dharma rain, the rain of compassion, the inconceivable rain, the rain of equal enlightenment guiding all beings, transforming body and mind, the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, expounds the inexhaustible ultimate sweet dew.
When going to the site of the Buddha tree, for the bodhisattvas he proclaims the great Dharma rain, called the Dharma realm that is indestructible, ultimately forming the stage of avinivartanÄ«ya;
It is also called the TathÄgata's secret treasury, the great Dharma rain that the bodhisattvas delight in, forming the bodhisattvas who are one birth away from Buddhahood;
There is a great Dharma rain called Adornment and Purification, which universally causes sentient beings to have nothing to violate or lose, and not to neglect bodhisattvas.
The TathÄgata's ground has a great Dharma rain called 'Adorning the Path and Adorning Oneself, Uniting with the Acceptance of the Dharma,' which causes bodhisattvas to gather precious wisdom;
There is a bodhisattva practice called 'Skillful Transformation,' which has nothing to cut off but expounds the Dharma rain;
The accomplished bodhisattva practice is called 'The Gate of No Arrogance,' entering the profound gate, practicing without laziness or weariness;
There is also a Dharma rain that causes those who first give rise to the bodhisattva mind to follow the unsurpassed path, called 'The TathÄgata's Practice.'
Great kindness and great compassion, leading to the salvation of the multitude;
Giving rise to the Dharma rain, transforming the pratyekabuddha vehicle;
Faithfully enjoying the middle way, manifesting and speaking for the multitude about the twelve links of dependent arising.

Or transcending existence with the fruit of liberation, called 'Entering the Boundless Realm of All Views,' expounding the Dharma rain and opening the Å›rÄvaka vehicle, which sentient beings faithfully enjoy.

Using the sword of holy insight to cut through all the defilements of afflictions, having the sword of wisdom to spread the Dharma rain, called rejoicing in the cessation of all harm, for the various wrong views that cannot be understood, accumulating roots of virtue and raining down the sounds of the Dharma, this is called the ten dharmas that clearly manifest the Dharma rain, all attaining fullness and pervading everywhere.
In accordance with their faith and joy, they will attain liberation. The TathÄgata then expounds the great Dharma rain, universally pervading the Dharma realm, reaching everywhere.

The Great Sage has never been stingy with the Dharma. According to the mature practices of sentient beings, he manifests the Dharma rain based on their various roots and origins and diligent efforts. This, Buddha's disciples!
Is the tenth matter of the practices of the bodhisattvas.
Just like clouds and fog gathering, the winds rise in the four directions,
Surpassing with timely rain, and the flowing of water.
The bodhisattvas distinguish and explain the roots of virtue of the people,
Therefore, in the present world, this trichiliocosm is established.
Thus it is with the ten powers, skillfully cultivating wisdom as the wind,
Causing the rain of Dharma to fall due to conditions, with a mind of purity and purity.
Observing sentient beings without compare, encouraging and assisting with purity,
That is to say, the ten powers, the guide opens up and transforms.
Above, in the empty sky, clouds gather and rain falls,
There is no one able to bear holding the rain water,
Only when the world encounters calamities and changes can it be able to endure it.
Speech is true and unattached, the realm of the body is vast and pervasive,
Thus it is with the ten powers, naturally nothing exists.
The great sage speaks of what exists, the words of the Dharma realm,
Raining the Dharma to transform, the moisture is immeasurable,
There is no one able to bear it, only the pure mind of the Dharma.
Never having had this thought, the past and future are the basis,
And also nothing is created, forever nothing is encountered.
Just like in the empty sky, clouds and mist bring rain,
It is only a nominally existent dharma, naturally without transformation.
The ten powers are like this, the Dharma rain has no existence,
There is also no coming, and I have never seen a going.
Exhausting the spiritual power of the bodhisattvas, and giving rise to this practice,
Awakening to the illusory transformations of dharmas, attaining the world and releasing the rain.
Sentient beings have no activity, then there is no three realms,
Just like the naturally formed canopy, releasing the rain drops according to the water.
Only the honored one has mastery, the name of the teaching of the trichiliocosm,
Creating and establishing freedom, this is the fundamental karmic reward.
The practice of rain is like this, pervading the Buddha lands without remainder,
One cannot calculate the number of thoughts and limitations.
For the sake of all sentient beings, the most revered in the world,
One contemplates the rain, with the palm of the Dharma treasure.
Tranquility corresponds to tranquility, naturally attaining understanding,
And also eliminating the remaining matters, the various obscurations that arise.
Abandoning these many faults, increasing the practice of the Dharma treasure,
The stage is able to accommodate the trichiliocosm, fully understanding everything.
The ten powers are the basis, extinguishing the desires of defilements,
Contemplating the natural, the merits are immeasurable.
Moreover, cutting off all wrong views,
Distinguishing the nature and conduct of the mind, the supreme treasure is wealth.
One flavor is true reality, like rain released in the sky,
The rain has no bounds, the scattered drops each have their place.
Moreover, considering the water, there is no thought of appropriateness or inappropriateness,
The multitude harbors joy, and thus various dharmas arise.
Moreover, as for the Dharma, it does not arise as one or many,
It has no fundamental taste, and no thought of appropriateness or inappropriateness.
Reaching the boundless, becoming a Buddha and the assembly of sages,
These will uphold it, such is the Dharma-image.
The Buddha said:
Using ten names and virtues in the TathÄgata's voice to enter the immeasurable.
What are the ten?
Wandering into space is immeasurable;
Universally reaching all Dharma realms is immeasurable;
Wandering into the remainderless, discerning and understanding the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable;
Wandering into all that delights the minds of the people, the direction of sin and merit is immeasurable;
Entering into the causes and conditions of karmic retribution and the various kinds of beings, eliminating the bonds of afflictions, wisdom is immeasurable;
Entering into the ultimate tranquil, serene, unborn sounds, it is immeasurable;
Following the joys of the multitudes and enlightening them, entering into the liberated mind, it is immeasurable;
In accordance with the taste of liberation, entering the three realms, without boundaries, it is immeasurable;
Dwelling in the bottomless, attaining the realm of no objects, entering into the practices of wisdom, it is immeasurable;
Selecting the essentials of the Dharma, the realm of the buddhas, never turning back, it is immeasurable;
Entering into the TathÄgata, in accordance with the Dharma, without playing, it is immeasurable.
In this way, Virtuous Eyes Bodhisattva!
For incalculable beings, the echo resonates with the sound of the TathÄgata.
Then he spoke in verse:
Using the ten virtuous deeds, entering the Buddha's immeasurable wisdom,
Reaching all dharmas, the realm without limits.
The great way is also like this, lofty and unfathomable,
Yet it has great compassion, and all are liberated.
Distinguishing the edge of birth and death, the myriad beings are boundless,
Transforming away various sins and blessings, delighting the mind and causing understanding.
Not seeking retribution, the wisdom of the way has no bounds,
